6) Diamond Jim - Try to beat the total of two 6 sided dice with one 8 sided die.

7) Unlucky One - Keep rolling the die and earning the number you roll, unless you roll a one, in which case you lose everything.

8) Lottery Dice - Everyone chooses a number, then a die is rolled. Whoever guessed the number wins the lottery.

9) Even Odds - Win double your bet if you correctly guess that two dice will be odd or even.

10) Challenge - Played against another player. Whoever rolls highest wins the bet.

11) Impossible 36 - Try to roll 36 by rolling two dice three times. Huge payout if you succeed.

There is an open house space that lets you play the game of your choice.

The game ends when the last player completes the last circuit of the board.

16014.name: Nephi's Courage
16014.description: Nephi's Courage is a deck of cards with which you can play Gadianton Robber (Old Maid), Seek and Ye Shall Find (Go Fish), and Ponder (traditional pair matching game) with characters from the Book of Mormon. Another Latter-Day Saint themed game for Family Home Evening or any family game time.

16016.name: Pin High
16016.description:
Simple Australian card game based on a 9 or 18 hole round of golf. There is no course (and no board), though players try to match the par scores for various well known courses (Augusta, Muirfield, Pebble Beach, Royal Melbourne, Royal Sydney and St Andrews).

Cards depict distances and various clubs including drivers, irons, putters, pitching wedges, "Lost Ball" various "Traps", and few nice ones like "Holed Approach", "Holed Putt".

16017.name: Call 'em All!
16017.description:
From the box:

"Call 'em' All is the furiously fast and frantic think it and shout it game.

In Call 'em All players are given a category and in 60 seconds they have to think of as many items to do with that category as they can and shout them all out.

This may sound easy, but, wouldn't you just know it, there's a catch! Shout as loud as you can, as quickly as you can, as many items as you can but the only ones which will score you points are the ones that appear on the card.

Call 'em All contains 130 categories as diverse as 'Types of Fruit', 'Parts of a Car' and 'Things Found in a Chemist'. It's a non-stop riot of laughter which will amuse you, your family and friends for hours.

Get your brain in gear, get your mouth in gear because Call 'em All is here.

Contents: 130 game cards, 2 sets of number cards, 1 scorepad, 1 pencil, 1 60 second timer, 2 counters, rules of the game."

Each player in turn takes a card from the deck, which will list a category and ten items in that category. They lay out ten cards numbered 1 to 10 to match the items, and place a counter on the item they think the other players are least likely to guess.

All the other players then have 60 seconds to shout out as many items as they can in the category, hoping to match the ten on the card. The player reading the category card turns over the number cards as the matching items are called.

At the end of the round, all the guessing players each score one point for each of the items they have collectively guessed, plus three bonus points if they guess the item with the counter on. The reading player scores one point for each item that was not guessed, again plus three bonus points if the counter-marked item was not guessed.

The next player then takes the next category card, and the previous card reader re-joins the guessers. In this way the game is co-operative, but the teams are constantly changing and each player will have their own individual score by the game end.

Play continues for as many rounds as the players decide, although for fairness everyone should have the same number of turns as the card reader.

Suitable for ages 10+.

boardgamehonor: 2002 Charles S. Roberts Best DTP-Produced Boardgame Nominee
16018.description: Covers "the woefully sorry invasion of Greece by Italy during WWII". One version of the game is historically accurate but unbalanced. It is good for study and solo play. The other version is a best case scenario that pretends the Italians were not as incompetent as they were historically, making the game more balanced and better for two players. The one and two-thirds sheets of counters that have to be mounted (good cardstock provided with game) and cut-out are simple and attractive, same for the map. 7.5 miles/hex, 1 mo/turn, battalions-divisions.
16018.name: Greek Tragedy

16019.description: A simulation of the 25 September 1396 Battle of Nicopolis in which the last major Crusader army tried to drive the Ottomans out of Europe. one 22x17 inch game map in two sections, 200 nice-looking mount and cut counters.
16019.name: Last Crusade

boardgamehonor: 2001 Charles S. Roberts Best DTP-Produced Boardgame Nominee
2001 Charles S. Roberts Best DTP-Produced Boardgame Winner
16020.description: A simulation of the two major battles early in the Hundred Years War-Crecy and Poitiers. From Berg's introduction: "The era, and these two battles, saw a change from the supremacy of heavy, armored cavalry to that of an infantry led by the defensive fire power of the longbow coordinated with the offensive capabilities of "Men- at-arms", either mounted or dismounted." One 22x17 map in two parts, one 11x17 map, 200 cut and mount counters. 145 yds/hex, 300 men/combat unit.
16020.name: Longbow

16021.name: Line of Fire
16021.description: Covers two Napoleonic Era battles far away from France. Maipo was the 1818 battle that led to independence for Chile. Lundy's Lane was the bloodiest battle of the War of 1812. Two 22x17 inch maps and 255 counters that have to be mounted and cut.

16022.name: Last Raid
16022.description: Simulates the 955 Battle of Lechfeld (near Augsburg, Germany) which pitted Western-style heavy cavalry against Eastern-style hit and run mounted archers. For two centuries, the deadly mounted Magyar archers had been raiding west, out of the Hungarian plains, devastating German duchies and reaching into the south of France. Hearing another raid was on the way, King Otto gathered an army of heavy, armored cavalry and marched to meet them. Uses the Simon Says game system which is similar to Kingdom for a Horse. 11x33 inch map, 200 counters that have to be mounted and cut.

16023.description: Simulates the two major battles of the 13th century revolt of Simon de Montfort against the rule of Henry III. Outnumbered two to one, and with his left wing of Londoners routed by an opening royalist cavalry charge, Simon still managed to smash Henry's tired army and capture the king and Prince Edward at the Battle of Lewes on 14 May 1264, but a year later dissension among the revolting barons and Prince Edward's great escape led to the death of Simon and the revolt at the Battle of Eveshame on 4 August 1265. Two 22x17 inch maps, 200 counters that have to be mounted and cut.
16023.name: Simon Says

16025.name: Join 5 Turn
16025.description: Join 5 Turn is an abstract strategy game for people ages 4 and up. It is basically a new twist on an old game. The old game being Connect Four - or in this case, five. each player has 13 tiles either red or blue and they try to get four or five in a row depending on the variation being played (there are three included with the game) the twist is that the board is mounted on an angled post and every time you place a tile you rotate the board a quarter turn. this causes the tiles to shift and adds a new strategy element to an old game

16026.name: Voyage to the Stars
16026.description:
Each player pilots a starship through the 12 constellations. While traveling through space, various dangers such as exploding stars and the Dreaded Black Hole will be encountered

Nuclear fuel chips provide the energy your starship needs to continue its journey. During the voyage, you may claim legal rights to any of the 36 stars in the Zodiac. Other players landing on your stars must surrender to you valuable fuel. Only then can they escape the gravitational pull of your stars

16027.description:
Galloping Golf is a dice driven game in which players compete at par 4 holes by rolling five dice with various outcomes. Each player scores between 2-9 per hole (no hole-in-one). Scores are tallied on scoring sheets and the lowest score wins.

A collectible feature of this game are the Bakelite/Catalin dice that are included. The game may have had several reincarnations, including being produced for Wilson Sporting Goods and for a company called Arl-Hi.

from the gameboard explanation

To anyone not experienced in golf, this game will prove very interesting and instructive. Anyone who does not play golf can quickly learn the Golf Game by reading the accompanying rules. Every member of the family will find this game delightfully instructive as well as a fascinating pastime.

The experienced golfer will be subject to many of the same interesting and thrilling situations which are found on the links.

This Golf Course is modeled after the famous Championship Golf Course, designed by the late Seth J Raynor. It is located in Fairyland, atop Lookout Mountain, Tennessee-Georgia, near Chattanooga, Tenn. The Location of greens, tees, hazards and the par figures shown are identical with the Fairyland Course.
16027.name: Galloping Golf

16028.name: Trafalgar
16028.description:
A legendary early self-produced, and accordingly rare, board wargame portraying the Battle of Trafalgar on a ship-to-ship scale. Game turns represented 10 minutes of real time. Features Basic Game rules, Optional rules, and Optional Tournament Game rules.

Reportedly only 450 copies were produced.

16029.description:
From the box: Scooter is all set for a busy day on the farm, discovering all the interesting things to be found there. Scooter sniffs high and low until he finds everything. Sometimes his friend Skippy joins him in the game.

Help Scooter the puppy find the hidden pictures.

Ages 4 - 8
16029.name: The Puppy Game

16030.description:
[From the back of the Manual]
Take control of the great battles of the 18th and 19th centuries with Volley & Bayonet. Created by the people who brought you Command Decision, Volley & Bayonet gives you the ability to recreate the full scope of the epic battles of the black powder era.

Each turn represents one hour on the battlefield but can be played in only fifteen to thirty minutes.

Suitable for 5mm all the way up to 30mm. Alternatively you can simply tack down your existing stands onto V&B sized bases, and you're ready to go.

Volley & Bayonet covers the entire period from the adoption of the socket bayonet (about 1700) up to the widespread issue of machineguns and magazine rifles (about 1890). The rules, with a few modifications to provide period flavor and to cover newer weapons, allow players to fight out battles throughout that entire dynamic era. All the battles and campaigns of Marlborough, Frederick, Napoleon, Lee and Grant, and Bismarck are at your disposal, and the rules include complete scenarios for almost a dozen battles.

Three scenario books published:
Battles of the American Civil War (GDW)--10 scenarios and a Campaign System using 'A House Divided' boardgame.
Napoleon Returns (Emperor's Press)--1815 Campaign. 4 scenarios, background and extensive info on the armies and uniforms.
Austria Stands Alone (Emperor's Press)--1809 Campaign. 5 scenarios, background and info on the armies and uniforms.

Expanded by:

Napoleon Returns: Waterloo Campaign Expansion for Volley & Bayonet
boardgameversion: On Military Matters Black & White Edition
16030.name: Volley & Bayonet
boardgameexpansion: Battles of the American Civil War:  A Sourcebook for Volley & Bayonet
Napoleon Returns: Waterloo Campaign Expansion for Volley & Bayonet
The Rough Riders: A Volley, Bayonet, & Glory Supplement, volume 1
The Rough Riders: A Volley, Bayonet, & Glory Supplement, volume 2

16031.name: Consensus
16031.description:
The gameboard is a map of the United States with many scales for record keeping around its perimeter. Each state shows how many electoral votes it is worth, how many phases must be spent to capture it and which demographics it represents.

The game turn begins with each player plotting their campaigns. When all the players have recorded their moves, the players campaign simultaneously. The campaign round consists of twenty-two phases. Players who have plotted identical campaigns in a state cancel each other.

After the third campaign phase and at the end of every campaign phase thereafter, each of the ten demographics catagories are calculated. Players who have the majority of the available electoral votes receive six extra phases to campaign in the states represented by the demographic won.

The game continues until forty electoral votes have been locked in as uncontested victories by all the players or until a target number of game turns have been played. Players total electoral votes won and the player who has 270 is the winner. If no one has 270, the last place finisher is eliminated and that player's electoral votes are doled out to whoever finished second in those states. This process is repeated until someone has enough to win the game.

16032.name: Fu Rin Ka Zan
16032.description:
This is a Japanese wargames published by Bandai on the
Climatic battle of 4th Kawanakajima between Shingen Takeda and Kenshin Uesugi.
It was well accepted by reviewers.
Basically, it was a variety of "Napoleon at Waterloo" with supply consumption and hidden movement.

16033.name: Chicanery
16033.description: Another variant in the Dictionary family of games, of which Balderdash is the widest-known member. Chicanery consists of a deck of 51 cards, each with 5 obscure words and their definitions. The players form two teams, and each team starts with one card; one word at a time is used, starting with the top word on the card. Each player on a team makes up a definition for the chosen word, and the fake definitions, along with the real one, are given to the other team, whose players try to guess which is the real one.

16034.description:
It’s the fun, acting-silly, hooray-you’re-so-brave game that kids love to play again and again! Created by doctors and a child psychologist to help every child develop confidence, creativity, and self-esteem.

Children earn Bravery Badges on the exciting journey to Mount Courage. By using imagination and creative play, players meet and master that Not So Scary Things (Thunder & Lightning, Monsters, Darkness, Spiders, Bullies & Meanies, and Snakes). Every child can win! Ages 4 - 8
16034.name: Not So Scary Things

boardgamehonor: 2007 Kinderspielexperten "8-to-13-year-olds" Nominee
2007 Kinderspielexperten "8-to-13-year-olds" Winner
16035.description:
Your dad likes poodles more than pickles? Your best friend likes bubblegum more than museums? Whoonu! In Cranium Whoonu, you're sure to have unforgettable fun as you reveal your favorite things, share hilarious stories, and bond over surprising connections. You'll be amazed at what you'll learn about your friends and family ? especially those you think you know best!

Cranium Whoonu is easy to learn and quick to play, so it's the perfect game for any occasion. And best of all, it's just as fun to play with people you've known for 5 minutes as it is with people you've known forever. For 3 to 6 players, Ages 8 and up

What's in the box? 300 game cards, 36 scoring tokens, and a secret envelope.
Note: The 2008 edition comes with 400 game cards
16035.name: Cranium Whoonu

16036.description:
From the box: Join Jonah in his misadventures as he tries to abandon his assignment to deliver a message of mercy to the people of Nineveh. He sets sail with The Pirates Who Don't Do Anything, meets Khalil the worm, survives stormy waters, learns the true meaning of "go fish", walks the plank, gets swallowed bu an enormous "fish", and ultimately is given a second chance by being "burped up" on shore.

Spin the spinner and follow Jonah's path to Nineveh while collecting reminders of Jonah's encounters. But be careful of possible setbacks along the way! Inspired by Jonah-A VeggieTales Movie(TM), children will play this hilarious fast-paced game time after time.

Ages 3 and up
16036.name: Jonah the Overboard Adventure Game!

16037.description:
From the box: At first glance, a lot of cards look alike. But if you look carefully you can see the differences. On some cards Elliot is holding a book. On others, his shirt has a moon instead of a star!

While playing the fast action games, children practice early observation and discrimination skills, essential elements in everyday reasoning.

Can you see what's different?

Ages 3 and up
16037.name: Elliot Moose Card Game

16038.name: The Donkey and the Carrot
16038.description: A game for 2 to 4 players Ages 4 and up. The object of the game is for each player to make a track from one corner square on the board, joining up with one of the paths leading into the stable and to move his donkey along this path. The player whose donkey enters the stable first being the winner.

16039.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

This is the Garfield Edition of Monopoly which celebrates Garfield 25th Anniversary
boardgameversion: Parker Brothers Garfield's 25th Anniversary Collector's Edition
16039.name: Monopoly: Garfield

16043.name: Ambition
16043.description:
Ambition is a trick taking standard deck playing card game. It was invented by Indie designer Mike Church whose stated goal was to create a trick game where the role of chance ("hand-luck") was as small as possible.

The usual object is to avoid taking the most points in a round and, secondarily, to score as many as possible up to that. (That is, if the 120 points split 42-34-25-19, it's best to be the '34' and worst to be the '42'.) Bonuses, known as Nil and Slam, are given respectively for taking no points or for taking 75+. Thus, almost any hand dealt has some strategy: few terrible hands exist.

Ambition is as much a game of players, and the interactions of their varying strategic objectives, as of cards.

For improvement's sake, the inventor has updated the game several times since its first publication in November 2003. The most recent rules were published in July 2012.

16044.name: The Bicycle Game
16044.description: The Bicycle Game was one of several board games published in the 1890s about that exciting new sport, bicycling. The board depicts an oval shaped racetrack divided into spaces. The object of the game is to win the race.

16045.name: Fan-Tel
16045.description: This vintage "fan that tells your fortune" game includes 48 fan-blade shaped fortune telling sticks packaged in a cardboard tube.

16046.name: The Elsie Game
16046.description: This vintage game involves rolling dice and moving tokens that represent cows along a set of winding paths. It is based on Elsie the Cow, which is a well known old mascot of the Borden Dairy Company. The goal of the game is to get the cows into the barn, which is located in the center of the board.

16047.name: Indiana Jones: Der Weg nach Timbuktu
16047.description:
"Indiana Jones starts a journey to Timbuktu to obtain the Golden Mask of an Egyptian pharaoh, which has been stolen 3000 years ago and was recently discovered by a friend. Indy's friend has hidden the mask by the 100 year old Tuareg, before he was carried of by greedy foreigners."

"Indy's friend was also able to wire a message about the location of the mask before he vanished. But it seems the secret was given away by someone because there are other man behind the treasure claiming to be Indiana Jones! But only the true Indiana Jones will stand the trials and adventures and get the Golden Mask from the wise Tuareg."

16048.name: Cinema
16048.description: Cinema is a trivia game where the question cards contain pictures from scenes, titles and things used in a particular film. Do you know the answer?

16049.name: Dictionwary
16049.description: A player reads aloud the first and last words on the pages of an opened dictionary. The other players think of words which fall between those keywords to spell and give their meaning. Points are awarded for the number of letters, the meaning of the word, and bonus letters. Dictionwary is a game for word lovers.

16050.name: Peg Baseball
16050.description: Peg Baseball is a vintage game for players Ages 8 and up. Players take turns rolling the dice and then moving their pegs to the bases and on towards home plate. The game consists a pair of dice, two sets of six pegs, a shaker, and a rules pamphlet. The game was originally released in 1915, and published fairly continuously until the early 1960s.

16051.description: The Little Orphan Annie Game is vintage game based on the famous comic strip character. It includes a circular patterned board, four dice and two shakers, and little cardboard pieces with wooden bases that represent the characters from the strip. The first player to reach the center of the board is the winner.
16051.name: Little Orphan Annie

boardgamehonor: 1979 Spiel des Jahres Recommended
16052.description: Parker Brothers' Merlin was a hand held electronic game following in the footsteps of Simon, which had been introduced a year earlier by rival game company, Milton Bradley. Many of us who were kids in the seventies will remember its distinctive red plastic, telephone-shaped appearance. Although less colorful than Simon, Merlin featured six different games, namely tic-tac-toe, music machine, echo, blackjack 13, magic square, and secret number. It was even possible to save games and select your level of difficulty on a scale of 1-9. In 1999, Merlin became available once again on the internet as a free download for your PC.
16052.name: Merlin

16053.name: Uranium Rush
16053.description: Uranium Rush was an "educator approved" game from the 1950s. Players begin with $15,000 and prospect for uranium in an area determined by a spinner (mountain, hills, or desert). Claims can be purchased for $1000 each and may be auctioned off or tested for uranium. This involves an electric "Geiger counter" that produces a buzzing sound if uranium is discovered. The claim is then sold to the federal government for $50,000. Players alternate turns until all claims have been staked and the person with the most money is declared the winner.

16054.name: Shiloh
16054.description:
Paraphrased from the rulebook:

This is the second edition of this game, the first was a limited run of approximately 75 copies in December 1971 in the 12th issue of Battleflag magazine.

238 counters (Third Millennia Edition)

16055.name: McDonaldland Match-Up Game
16055.description: This game, based on McDonalds restaurant characters, is actually 3 games-in-one. In the first game, 5 cards depicting shadows of the characters are placed in the center of the table. The regular cards are then dealt out evenly among the players. On your turn, you turn over your top card so that all players may see it. The first player to slap the matching shadow card wins the character card. The winner is the first player to collect one each of all 5 McDonaldland characters. In the second game, players try to match cards in their hands to the top card on the center stack by using colors or numbers (shadow cards are wild). The third game is played solitaire. You draw a card and try to match it to the face up card on the table. If you can, you play it on top; if you can't, you start a new pile. If the top card of a pile matches another pile card, the 2 piles may be merged. You win if you have 2 piles or less after you've gone through the deck.

16056.name: Chicken Limbo
16056.description:
From the back of the box:
Line up with your friends as you listen to the singing chicken clucking a song. Then bend down low-under the chicken legs you go. Backward, forward, silly walks, too. Six positions in all to do. But don't touch the chicken. If you do, you're out! The last player left is the winner!

Kids try to limbo under the "legs" of the chicken.

16057.name: Minister i klister
16057.description: You are the Prime Minister (oddly there is four parties (purple, yellow, red and green) all with their respective Prime Minister!) and try to control your ministers so you can stay in power. But some of the ministers leak stories to the press, but who is doing it? Ministers that become too involved in sleazy affairs will be sacked and given new roles as county governors (of which there was 25 in Sweden at this time, correctly reflected in the map of the game). The player (Prime Mister / party) with the fewest county governors when all 25 has been appointed, wins the game.

16058.name: Le Maître du Rayon
16058.description:
Based on the Belgian comic Blake et Mortimer. In this game you try to prevent the evil Olrik from obtaining a deadly device which can destroy the world.

A player gains points by saving cities. Each turn a player plays a card. First he/she follows the instructions of the card played. Then the player moves his/her pawn as many spaces as indicated on the card. When a player finds a deadly device, he or she looks secretly at the name of the city written on the device.
If the city isn't threatened by Olrik, the player puts back the device. Otherwise the player places the deadly device in front of him/her.
The the player takes an Olrik Execution Card and threaten a city and rotates the spinner. If the number is lower than the number of the city, it stays there and players can save the city. If not, the city is destroyed.
If all cities are destroyed and/or saved the game ends. The player with the most points wins the game.

16059.description: Based on the famous comic by Hergé in this game you follow Tintin and his friends on their journey to the moon.
16059.name: Tintin et Milou vers la lune

16060.name: Byråkrat
16060.description: Racing game with bluffing mechanics, where you don´t win if you win the race. Instead you aim to move as little as possible and try to be the last person remaining on the game board.

16061.name: Babes in Toyland
16061.description: This game was inspired by the Disney musical, Babes in Toyland. Players move around the board collecting jigsaw pieces of toy soldiers. The first player to complete his or her own toy soldier from these pieces is the winner.

16062.name: King Zor: The Dinosaur Game
16062.description:
From Erik Arneson at About.com:

"Produced by Ideal in 1962, this game is based on the toy of the same name. It came with four cavemen to represent the players (green, yellow, red, blue), 16 dinosaurs (four each in the same colors), a variety of dinosaur eggs, two decks of cards, a spinner, and the game board. The board was illustrated with about two dozen dinosaurs, plus various geological features."

16063.name: Full Metal Conquête
16063.description:
Published in Backstab magazine n°43 (March/May 2003 - FC Publications [Asmodée / Halloween Concept]) as an homage to the original and very rare game Full Metal Planète.

10 years after the mineral gold rush from the Full Metal Planète game, the spacecrafts are returning to the mother planet only to reach it after a nuclear war that devastated the Earth. Instead of joining forces, the 2 groups continue their rivalry in trying to save the remaining survivor who are hidden in bunkers.

Full Metal Conquête allows 2 players to try to save survivors on a devastated Earth.

There is no change in the rules. Water was replaced by radioactivity, but everything works the same with different names.

Map is 13 x 30 hexes.

All the game (i.e. rules, counters, map) is on the central poster of the magazine. Counter must be glued on cardboard and cut.

The game is produced in French.

16064.name: Gambler
16064.description:
From the game's website:

Gambler was invented by Charlie Towlson and friends in 1987 and has attracted a huge cult following amongst those who play it. This has lead to annual tournaments, most notably the UK Championships which grows in attendance every year.

The object of the game is to gamble your way around the world on a set course of Reno -> London -> Monte Carlo -> Tokyo -> Sun City -> Las Vegas. The game is won when a player completes the course and finally wins a bet in Las Vegas. This means that the climax to every game is always a winning bet; failure to win that bet means the game continues.

Gambler made its serious debut at the London International Toy Fair in 1998 and was voted in the Top Ten New Games.

16065.name: Walt Disney Donald Duck Game (Treasure Hunt)
16065.description:
Donald Duck game is an exciting treasure hunt. The game is simple, so are the rules.
Dice are throw and players move around the board clockwise. When picture squares are landed on they look across to the Treasure Hunt Sheet and match there picture - players must comply with instructions. Winner is first person to reach the center.

16066.name: TaleSpin: Flying Aces & Air Show
16066.description:
This is actually two separate decks of 20 cards each, used to play (minor) variations of a couple of children's card games with a light TaleSpin theme.

Air Show, played with the cards depicting characters from the show, is a Memory-type game. The cards are dealt, face down, in a 4-by-5 rectangle. Players take turns flipping two cards face up; if they match, the player keeps the pair and goes again, otherwise the cards are flipped face down and the turn passes to the next player. One minor rule that I don't remember from the original Memory game is that, once a pair is removed, the holes that are thus formed are immediately filled by shifting cards to the right.

Flying Aces, played with the cards depicting the airplanes, is a variant of War. Each player is given a stack of cards; everyone places their top card face up in the center of the table, and if exactly one player plays a Sea Duck, they win all the cards; otherwise, it's a tie, and everyone goes again.

16067.description:
A long time ago in a galaxy far, far away.....
It is a time of civil war. Brave freedom-fighters of the Rebel Alliance struggle against the tyranny of the Galactic Empire. Though they have won several small victories, the Alliance is outnumbered and outgunned by the technological might of the Empire. Gathering their forces, the Rebels launch a last, desperate attack against the imperial fleet...

Welcome to Galactic Battle, the strategic space combat game of the Star Wars galaxy. As commander of either the Rebel Alliance or the Empire, an entire fleet of starships awaits your command. The fate of the galaxy is in your hands!

Ages 5 and up

Re-implements:

Battleship
16067.name: Star Wars Electronic Galactic Battle

16068.name: Europa på boks
16068.description:
Europa på boks
A trivia game based on what you know about Europe. You are sent on a mission. The first one to fulfill their mission is the winner.
To do so you have to use every bit of knowledge you have about Europe, its geography, languages, cultures and flags.

There is also the possibility to challenge an opponent and steal cards.....if you know or remember the answers on that specific card.

The game contain 330 cards, 2300 questions, 50 mission cards, 2 dices, 1 notepad.

16072.name: Naval Battle in the Sea of Japan
16072.description:
Naval wargame for battles in Russo Japanese war 1904-1905. The game title means Battle of Tsushima in Japanese, but game covering five major battles in the war.

Players control either Japanese or Russian fleet.
In Each turn, each player conduct one movement phase and two fire combat phase. Fire combat is using classical odds ratio combat result table and two dice.
Based on the historical result of Tushima, Japanese Navy has various advantage.

Victory condition is vary by scenarios.

16073.name: Eldorado
16073.description:
Each player is a governor which seeks to obtain the greatest possible richness for its country in various fields (atomic missiles, secrecies, planes and tankers, uranium and diamonds). He also tries to constitute gold reserves, to pay the taxes…

It's a "monopoly-like" game with auction created in France, in the 60's

16074.name: Final Twilight Customizable Card Game
16074.description:
In the near future, on the western coast city of New Metropolis, an evil that has lain dormant for centuries is about to be awakened to the 21st century. Forces of darkness and magic strive to unleash a horror upon the Earth unlike any mankind can remember. The only forces capable of stopping it are rendered impotent by an age-old fear and hatred. Will humanity set aside their differences and stand as one against the darkness? Or will this be humanity's Final Twilight?

Final Twilight is a modern fantasy themed card game for two players.
Players each select a Major Character featured in the game's storyline and build a deck around that character; supporting characters, special action and spells, weapons and items, all ripped from the pages of the story come to life on the game board.
Using Location cards to build a small portion of the great city of New Metropolis, players move between sites and backdrops of the story, dueling other characters including fantastic creatures, horrors of the shadows, and helpful, though innocent, bystanders.
Magic is scarce and unusual in the world of Final Twilight. While hiring goons and allies from our normal world can be easy, summoning the vast forces of nature takes its toll; fantastic characters, spells, and magical abilities all require a small piece of the mage. To cast these spells players spend a portion of their life total, potentially granting them greater power but opening them up to easier defeat. Winning is balancing the quest for power against the will to survive!

Final Twilight is customizable and non-collectable, with each release featuring pre-constructed decks and expansion packs containing just the right cards for a character or an assortment of universal cards suitable for any character.

Revised Edition

April 2013 The Revised edition officially released! Title available through print-on-demands services DriveThruCards.com and TheGameCrafter.com

16075.name: Bernard & Bianca
16075.description: Based on the Disney cartoon of the same name. In this game you race around a track and encounter characters from the movie.

16076.name: Jack & Jane In An Aeroplane
16076.description: The game box contains only the game board and 1 bone die (according to the instructions, counters were not supplied as the players were expected to provide their "Aeroplanes" with lead, paper figures or counters). Printed in Bavaria by the British games manufacturer "Spears" before WWI, it's one of the many clones of the older "The Game of Goose". The mechanic is fair simple, with the players alternating rolling the die and advancing their counters, ending by chance on some bonus or malus spaces and resolving the special effects before passing the turn to the next player. The game ends as the winning player reaches the winning post (50).

16077.name: Lost in Space
16077.description:
The game consists of a 16x16" full color board and various pieces. In this game of luck, players must travel over the wild and hazardous LOST IN SPACE unknown planet. The spinner tells them in what direction they must move each turn. They may be forced to move off the path or even into the monster pit which will send them back to start...
Winner is the player who lands on his finish circle first.

16079.description: This games has nothing to do with Squaredance. It is an abstract tactical game. Pieces move and kick each other off the board in squares.
16079.name: Squaredance

16080.description:
Every player owns 12 counters. Place these counters on the board. The player with the largest area gets the most points.
No. 49 Spielbox edition.
16080.name: Tolle Tomaten

16081.description:
Build the City of Babylon. When the game is over every building with the same roof color is removed. For those who are left you will earn points.
Spielbox edition No.31
16081.name: Bauboom in Babylon

16082.name: Baseball by the Numbers
16082.description:
A baseball game for two or more players. The player at bat and the player in the field both roll dice for each at bat. If the results of the two dice rolls match, the batter makes contact with the ball. If they do not match, the outcome of the pitch is a ball, a strike, or a foul ball.

If the batter makes contact, the player at bat rolls the dice again to determine where on the field the ball is hit. The player in the field then rolls a die and moves a fielder based upon that roll in an attempt to make a play on the ball. If a fielder cannot be moved where he can make a play, the result is a base hit. If he can make a play, the result is an out.

The game comes packaged in a box which contains the title "Baseball by the Numbers" in large letters and the following sub-title: "New strategy game to teach the young and challenge the pros! Because when you get down to it, the game is played BY THE NUMBERS!"

Contents included: gameboard, 4 game markers, 20 scorekeeping pieces, 18 player pieces, and 4 dice.

16084.name: Rodeo Rama
16084.description:
Ever dream of saddling up and being a Pro Rodeo Cowboy?

Now you can bring the rodeo home with the Rodeo Rama board game. Players have their choice of competing in one of six exciting rodeo events.

• Saddle Bronc Riding
• Bull Riding
• Bareback Riding
• Barrel Racing
• Steer Wrestling
• Calf Roping

Feel the adrenaline rushing excitement as you try to ride your way to victory at one of four rodeo locations on the game board. Draw event cards at each rodeo to determine your fate. Will you make the eight second ride or get bucked off as soon as you leave the gate? Better hope for a good draw!

But remember, as a Rodeo Rama cowboy, your winnings and a meager monthly salary are your only sources of income. You must make the best of each rodeo because to win the game you must have earned at least $30,000 and purchased a truck, horse, trailer, and saddle!

Do you have what it takes to compete and survive in one of the toughest sports in the world? Play Rodeo Rama and find out!

16085.description:
LEGENDS OF WRESTLING is a card and dice game that features playing cards for 24 professional wrestling legends! The playing cards have a drawing of the wrestler on the front and game information on the back. For example, the back of the card features the wrestler's favorite moves (such as Jimmy Snuka's SUPERFLY LEAP finisher) and other realistic characteristics specifically catered to each wrestling legend! LEGENDS features a fast-action game system that allows matches to take place in real time. You can play alone or with friends.

The LEGENDS OF WRESTLING Box Set includes 24 wrestler playing cards, dice, playing charts, instruction book, and game handbook. You'll be the promoter and booker for your own wrestling federation featuring the greatest roster in history! Each expansion game adds another 12 cards to the game!
16085.name: Legends of Wrestling

16086.name: The Gender Gap (2nd Edition)
16086.description:
From the box:

Gender Gap 2 is a game that tests both adult men and adult women on their ability to predict how other players really think about present day issues and situations. The questions are designed to be both topical and likely controversial, with the hope that it will create exciting discussion among the players regarding moral, ethical, relationship, parental and lifestyle topics. Gender Gap 2 deals with situations that are top of mind but sometimes never discussed.

Brief description:

Players take it in turn to act as a reader, reading aloud a statement relating to gender roles (i.e. "European men are more secure in their masculinity than North American men"). The reader than picks a rating from 1 (strongly disagree) to 7 (strongly agree) and everyone else secretly tries to guess the readers choice.

The choice and all guesses are revealed simultaneously. Correct guessers roll the dice to move forward, everyone else moves back a number of spaces equal to the difference between the guess and the actual answer.

16087.description: Players try to get their own pawns into the center of the gameboard. Every player owns 9 pawns. One player is Ti the other Ja.
16087.name: TiJa

16088.name: Calaboose
16088.description:
Calaboose is an exciting card game for 2-5 players (ages 12+) from Live Oak Games. Players play the part of sheriffs in the Old West, each trying to capture the highest value collection of outlaws in their jails.

Your jail (aka Calaboose) is a collection of cards kept face up on the table in front of you. Jails can only hold 5 outlaws at any one time, and each outlaw has a "strength" rating.

On your turn, you can either place an outlaw from your hand into an empty slot in your jail or into someone else's jail. The outlaws each have "power" ratings. An outlaw can be sent to replace a weaker outlaw in someone else's jail.

You can defend your jail. If someone sends an outlaw to your jail, you can eliminate him with one of your outlaws - but you have to send your defender to someone else's jail. That person can defend against you, of course, so each turn has the possibility of generating a chain reaction that involves multiple players around the table.

It's a lighthearted social game with a solid core of strategy. Higher value cards tend to be weaker, and sets (or "gangs") are worth much more than singletons. Everyone at the table can see what's in your jail, so as you gain the advantage you also acquire a bullseye. Attacking another player's jail may backfire on you, so you have to be careful and constantly adjust your strategy to the cards on the table.

16089.description: Every player tries to get the most influence in the different areas. There are 8 areas with different values.
16089.name: Kastellan

16090.description:
Paulus' 6th Army is an operational level simulation of the Soviet encirclement operation named "Operation Uranus" and the German escape attempt from Stalingrad from 19th November to 24th December, 1942.

This game represents the first significant operational victory of the previously inferior Soviet Red Army over the Wehrmacht. For this reason, the battle of Stalingrad in often referred to as the "turning point" of the World War II. But in this game, the German player has more options of command than Friedrich Paulus, the commander of German 6th Army. So the German player may conduct withdraw from Stalingrad with his troops as he chooses and may defend more effectively than the historical static situation.

(source: Six Angles webpage)
16090.name: Paulus 6th Army

16091.description:
36 counters are placed on the 36 spaces of the board. There are positive ones and negative ones. Try to get the positive ones and avoid the negative ones.
Graphics: I. Vohwinkel
16091.name: Quadrato

16092.name: Toxic Crusaders Card Game
16092.description:
Players battle Good Guy and Bad Guy cards for the right to clean up Tromaville.

Mini-cards are dealt in a 'Memory' fashion. Numbered cards are flipped over, with the winner attempting to make matches from the memory board. The player with the most matches wins the game.

Box Contents: 18 Good Guy & Bad Guy cards, 36 Toxic Clean-Up Time mini cards, 1 card tray, 1 spinner, and instructions.

16093.name: Monster Tank
16093.description:
Part of their sports and adventure series, this is a simple tactical game on modern tank battles.

Published by Ad Technos in Japanese.

16094.description:
Collect cards and make combinations.
You also have pawns. The first player who is able to place all his pawns on the board wins the game. The board shows 10 spaces. Number 2 to 7 and 4 card colors.
Graphics: Franz Vohwinkel
16094.name: Top

16095.description:
Every player owns 9 pawns. The goal is to get them to the opposite side first. How far you can move depends on how many pawns are in the row 90 degrees of the pawn that you want to move.
Graphics: Franz Vohwinkel
16095.name: Quatrix

16096.description:
Every player tries to get a connection of his 2 pawns. The pawns are on the opposite side on the gameboard. Every player also ones counters with numbers on them. Like if you use the 0 counter you do nothing, play the 2 counter bring two tokens into the gameplay.
Graphics: Franz Vohwinkel
16096.name: Tabalati

16097.description:
Dominoes are placed on the gameboard. On your turn remove one of them. One of the numbers tells you how far to go, the other number in which row you are allowed to move.

Graphics: Christof Tisch
16097.name: Dominanz

16098.description: Goal is to earn the most points. Points are counted for areas contolled. Roll 2 dice. Use them to determine on which space on the gameboard you are allowed to place a piece.
16098.name: Sechs: Ex

16099.description: Try to get as many pawns as possible to the finish line. Play cards to move your pieces.
16099.name: Strandläufer

16100.description: Counters are placed on board. Play cards to get those counters. Also the cards may have a value after you played them. Depends on the order they are played.
16100.name: Lonely Heart

16101.description: Goal of the game is to place pieces on the board to earn the most points. First pieces are placed on the board. Second they are moved.
16101.name: Rangeln

16102.description: Place stones and win whenever you earned 40 points.
16102.name: Versuch dein Glück

16103.description:
Every player owns 17 pawns. Try to get the most influence on most spaces. The board looks like the ancient Rome or something like that. The story is about Caesar and how the game got its name.
Graphics: Christof Tisch/Dennis Braun
16103.name: Quadringentesimus Quadratum

16104.description: Whoever get rid off their chips first wins the game. Roll the dice. Place one chip on the gameboard. For every dice with the same number as on the gameboard, place one more chip.
16104.name: Beletage

16105.description:
Champions of the Galaxy is a card game combining sci-fi and wrestling into an all-action game! It's Star Wars meets the WWE! You'll enter the Future of Wrestling in the GWF!

Champions of the Galaxy is a card and dice game that features playing cards for 24 galactic wrestling legends! The playing cards have a drawing of the wrestler on the front and game information on the back. Champions of the Galaxy features a fast-action game system that allows matches to take place in real time. You can play alone or with friends.
16105.name: Champions of the Galaxy

boardgamehonor: 1987 Årets Spel Best Children's Game Winner
16106.name: Barnen i Bullerbyn
16106.description: Abstract strategy game based on the story of the same name by Astrid Lindgren.

16108.name: Akropolis
16108.description: Akropolis is a three-dimensional abstract strategy game for 2 players. As in the ancient world, columns and temples will be built. Each player tries to make use of the hard work of his opponent for himself. The aim of the game is to get several columns together in a particular arrangement or to build a temple.

16109.name: Civilization Eastern Expansion Map
16109.description:
Published in Spanish Alea Magazine issue 21, includes an Eastern map (Mesopotamia) to add to the basic game.

It includes:

4 new cultures: Persia, Sumer, Samita and Indus
5 new cards

boardgamehonor: 2004 Japan Boardgame Prize Best Japanese Game Nominee
16110.description:
A very simple, ancient Italian card game. It is popular to this day in Italy, Germany, and Scandinavia. It is played with a 40-card deck composed of number and picture cards. There are two of each card (i.e. 20 distinct cards).
Each player is dealt a single card. The goal is to avoid holding the lowest valued card at the end of a turn around the table. Each player may exchange cards with the previous player without knowing what the other player holds.
16110.name: Il Cucco

16111.name: Karl-Alfreds Skattsökarspel
16111.description:
Game based on Popeye the sailor. In this game Popeye is searching for a treasure, but Brutus will do anything in his power to stop him.

Players use a spinner to move along paths of connected spaces, aiming to reach treasure islands in order to collect correspondingly coloured chests. A player who has collected a chest of every colour may head for their home space, but landing on a Brutus space means the loss of a chest, and rolling the exact number of spaces is required to return home as well as when collecting the chests.

boardgamehonor: 1984 Årets Spel Best Children's Game Winner
16112.description: The game about World's Strongest Bear and his companions searching for honey. Basic roll and move childrens game where you help the teddy bear find honey. The player who finds most honey wins the game.
16112.name: Bamses honungs-jakt

16114.name: Élan
16114.description:
[From the manual]

Elan is designed for Wargames representing Divisional and Corps sized combat on the European continent from 1805 to 1815 in 25mm or 15mm. It provides gamers with a system focused on the tactical employment of units from Brigade down to company level.

Elan aims to capture the feel of combat during the period, and will satisfy players who approach their games with an appreciation for the actual tactics used by the Generals of the period. Use of combined arms, effective command and keeping a reserve up your sleeve are the keys to success.

The rules are also perfect for tournament games allowing for objectives, quick results and good reflection of a player's ability as opposed to just sheer luck.

For play purposes a Tactical Turn represents about 20 minutes, and with the Grand Tactical aspects included, a Turn represents about 1 hour. All measurements are in millimeters representing 1 meter per millimeter. The rules are written with measurements for 25mm scale figures, but 15mm is equally suitable by modifying distances.

Includes reference charts.

16115.description:
[From the manual]

This Standard Rulebook may be used with all games in the series 'Les Batailles dans L'Age L'Empereur Napoleon Premier'. This is the fourth edition; the Regulations of the Year XXII. Basic concepts of play are detailed herein. Events particular to a certain battle are covered in the Special Rulebook accompanying each game.

- Warning: These rules are more suitable for advanced players.

- Suitable for Solitaire Play: Much more so than in previous editions.

- Extensively Illustrated Examples of Play are included.

- Compatible with all previously published La Bataille titles (in order of their appearance):

Expands:

La Bataille de la Moscowa
La Bataille d'Auerstædt
La Bataille de Preussisch-Eylau
La Bataille d'Espagnol: Talavera
La Bataille d'Austerlitz
La Bataille de Deutsch-Wagram
La Bataille d'Albuera: Espagnol
La Bataille de Ligny
La Bataille des Quatre Bras
La Bataille de Mont Saint Jean
La Bataille de Wavre
La Bataille de Corunna-Espagnol
La Bataille de Lützen
La Bataille d'Orthez
boardgameversion: 4th Edition of the La Batailles Series Standard Rules
16115.name: Regulations of the Year XXII
boardgameexpansion: La Bataille de Mont Saint Jean

16117.name: The Nuclear Energy Game
16117.description:
"Own, Operate, or Meltdown Your Own Plant."

The Nuclear Energy game is one of several to come out in the wake of the incident at Three Mile Island. Players attempt to acquire operating licenses for nuclear power plants, which serve as a source of income. Similarly, they try to avoid meltdowns or other mishaps at those same plants. Licensed sites serve as a source of income from other players who land on them as well as producing contract fees in their own right. After a pre-determined amount of time (the designer suggests 90 minutes), players tally assets and the person with the highest total wins.

There are humorous touches in both the instructions and on the game board, ranging from the disclaimer that any small errors "were incorporated intentionally in order to confuse the foreign intelligence community," to a sign pointing away from the power plant marked "fallout shelter" and another pointing straight down marked "China". The back page gives a line-item account of the actual events at Three Mile Island leading to the release of radioactive gas.

16118.name: Rick's Reef
16118.description:
From Publisher-
You and your crew have been invited to participate in a three day competition to photograph as many Caribbean fish and wildlife as possible. But you are not the only team! Rick has also invited some of the best divers to compete against you so you will need to efficiently use all of your resources including your crew if divers and their equipment to confuse and delay the other competitors.

Rick’s Reef, a collectible card game designed by divers for divers. There are 12 different types of divers, 7 kinds of equipment available to them and over 65 different types of fish and coral you can discover. And just to make it interesting there are 9 types of “problems” you can create for your opponent to throw his divers off balance.

16119.description: The goblins are going on vacation. Can you help them collect everything they need for the trip? Players take turns using a spinner to move their goblin around the board, but they must stop at certain points to wait for other players to arrive and help them acquire the necessary provisions. First goblin to the car wins.
16119.name: Autolino

16120.name: IQ Squared
16120.description:
Move round the board and answer bronze, silver or gold IQ questions for 1, 2 or 3 points. Collect points to move to another circuit on the board, and then to the center. A bit like trivial pursuit but with IQ questions.

It has the makings of a great game, but lacks something which keeps your attention. Have rarely played it to the finish.

16121.name: Napoleon Returns: Waterloo Campaign Expansion for Volley & Bayonet
16121.description:
(from the manual :)

Napoleon Returns is a Volley & Bayonet scenario book covering history's most famous campaign. It provides:

- historical background on the four battles of Quatre Bras, Ligny, Waterloo & Wavre.
- complete scenarios for all four battles.
- a Campaign System which allows you to re-fight history's most famous campaign.
- a rules update to refine Volley & Bayonet for Napoleonic Warfare.
- an extensive look at all the armies and their uniforms.
- a complete order of battle, and labels for unit bases to allow quick set-up.
- a point system to allow you to design you own scenarios.
- 9 maps, one each for the terrain and deployment for each battle, and a 2 page campaign map.

Volley & Bayonet is the most practical way to fight the great campaigns of 1815. Find out if Napoleon has to meet another Waterloo.

16122.description: Another version of the classic board game Monopoly. This time you are taken to the city of Townsville to hang out with Buttercup, Blossom, Bubbles, Professor Utonium, The Mayor, and Mrs. Keane. The basic game rules are the same. What is different... well the look of the board and pieces reflect the Cartoon Network hit show, the Powerpuff Girls. Townsville dollars replace Monopoly money. Forces of evil and hotline cards replace chance and community chest cards. Townsville properties replace the usual deeds. In place of railroads there are Townsville landmarks. You can also use 3 villain characters with the special Powerpuff Girls optional rules.
16122.name: Monopoly: Powerpuff Girls

16123.description:
Each Anno Domini set consists of 336 cards, with a description of a historical event on one side of the card, and the year (and sometimes specific date) in which it happened on the other.

Each player receives nine of these cards (or less, if you want the game to be shorter), and may only look at the descriptions. Players then put in turn a card on the table, *trying* to put theirs in chronological order. A player may, instead of adding a card, claim that the order in which the cards were put is incorrect. In this case all cards are turned over and the correct years revealed.
If the order was correct then the doubting player receives two cards and skips a turn. If the order was incorrect then the previous player, who accepted the order as correct, receives three cards. The first player that gets rid of all the cards wins.

Bluffing is as least as important as knowledge in this game. Most events are rather obscure or are hard to date exactly, so this ain’t no game for the nerds/geeks of this world, even they might think so, because it’s full of surprises and pure fun. Highly recommended, because Anno Domini is a blast to play, is a very enjoyable social event and you even learn something from it.

Unfortunately there is no English edition in existence, but this game could be a good way, to improve your already existing German skills or a very good reason, to learn German language in the first place.

The set "Sachsen" contains historical events which are related to Sachsen. This relationship is not necessary obvious. Like all Anno Domini the Sachsen edition can be played as standalone or mixed with some or even all editions.

Part of the Anno Domini series
16123.name: Anno Domini: Sachsen

16126.description: A Player talks to nine girls living in an old-fashioned apartment called Hachimitsu-So, in a effort to collect "positive feeling" cards. By taking a girl out using those cards, you receive points. The more cards you collect, the more points you get. Whoever gets the most points achieves the right to live in Hachimitsu-So.
16126.name: Hachimitsu

16127.name: Police Chase
16127.description: Police Chase Game is a Milton Bradley game for ages 6 and up. Join the race for the rooftop robber! A bandit has stolen the priceless jewel and hidden it in one of the buildings downtown. He jumps from rooftop to rooftop to avoid the Police. You are a police officer on his trail. Your job is to travel through the city to gather the evidence and get a warrant. You must also recover the stolen jewel. Along the way you may meet one of your partners who can help you find what you need. Once you've collected the evidence, a warrant and the jewel, you can capture the robber and bring him to justice.

16128.description:
This game was released at the same time of the movie "Bibi Blocksberg und das Geheimnis der blauen Eulen!" (translated as Bibi Blocksberg and the Secret of the Blue Owls!) in Germany. The movie (with the title character Bibi, who is a young witch) is based on a decades-old, long-running radio play and animated series but was also inspired by the success of the Harry Potter movies.

It's a roll and move game for juniors with four quests to complete. Roll and move effect is mitigated in a number of ways - players can re-roll once in each turn and they can collect helping cards when arriving on specific spaces or rolling a pentagram. The four quests are as follows:
- Library: find the book that opens a secret door to the secret passage. For this, find the same-colored book as the spaces you arrive on.
- Maze: to find your way through the maze, move the 5 moving pentagon tiles showing parts of the maze. These can be moved (turned or moved to different spaces) when rolling a pentagram or when arriving on a pentagon space. Cards might also help.
- Suspended bridge: each step (space) has some hidden traps that are revealed when stepping on them, easily causing players fall into the abyss. Some of them can be avoided with knowledge (knowing which blue owl has which number on its bottom), others with planning and luck (e.g. tiles where you fall into the abyss if you arrived there with specified die rolls), others with discarding a card. If a player falls into the abyss they have to climb back to the bridge and try again. The task gets easier once tiles are revealed and players know what to expect.
- The Five Owls: owls have to be placed on the five numbered spaces in order (the owl with number 1 to space 1 and so on). If a player fails they go back to the entrance of the owls hall. The numbers on the bottom of the owls can be looked at during game (with cards or when rolling a pentagram) but whenever they are checked (secretly, by the active player) they are placed back to another space so their location keeps changing and players must watch their movement closely during the course of the game.
The first player to correctly place the fifth owl to its corresponding place on the last space of the path wins.
16128.name: Bibi Blocksberg und das Geheimnis der blauen Eulen!

16129.name: Trivial Pursuit: Pocket Player Set – TP's People
16129.description:
(From the box:) Trivial Pursuit Pocket Player Sets let you play a great new way - anywhere, without a board! With the new Pocket Player Spinner/Scorers, just spin to select a question category and slide to keep track of your score. The first player or team to score correct answers in all six categories wins. Here's a fast-playing game that goes right to the heart of Trivial Pursuit. Those famous, fascinating questions!
1,440 all-new questions about famous - and infamous - personalities.

16130.name: Trivial Pursuit Junior Fourth Edition
16130.description:
(from the box:) From bats and cats to spiders and space... from Little Miss Muffet to the Liberty Bell... here are questions specially written for children age 8 and up. And this fourth edition has twice as many questions as earlier games.
As always, Trivial Pursuit Junior has the same game play and all the fun and challenge of the adult edition, with questions in these kid-friendly categories:
Every Day
Fun
Science
Stories & Songs
Nature
Games

16131.description:
This is a Master Game, complete with board, die, moving pieces and scoring wedges. The cards are the same as in the popular Baby Boomer Edition Subsidiary Card Set. The board is the same as from the original 1981 Trivial Pursuit. In some printings, the background color of the board is the same garnet shade as the box. In others it is blue, identical to the original board.

The categories are:
Television
Stage & Screen
Nightly News
Publishing
Lives & Times
R.P.M.
16131.name: Trivial Pursuit: Baby Boomer Master Game

16132.description:
This is a master game, complete with board. The instructions and questions are entirely in Spanish and cover the 1992 Olympics in Barcelona.
Categories are:
Futbol y Baloncesto
Paises y Lugares Olimpicos
Otros Deportes Olimpicos
Deportes Olimpicos Basicos
Vips y Personajes
Historia y Noticias del Deporte
16132.name: Trivial Pursuit: Edicion Olimpica [Spanish]

16133.name: Insider
16133.description:
One of Gerhard Kodys' better games, the game concerns moving in the right social circles and this gaining the best seats at a restaurant.

From the game rules description:

The Game of Appearance and Reality

The “400”, the “glitterati”, the “beautiful people” and the “VIP’s”. Who wouldn’t want to be part of their world of luxury, glamour and glitz…

However, we can’t all belong to it. The road to the top leads through the best tables at the INSIDER! The super-luxury-IN-temple in the center of the city. “The” restaurant.

Those seen there may rightfully count themselves among “High Society”. But in order to reach your goal must you keep your adversaries at bay. By use of "Scandals", "Rumors", "Contacts" and many other actions you are trying to climb the social ladder while trying to put a spike in the wheel of your opponents. Lucky for you that having a "Bodyguard" handy just might save you from just about everything.

And don't despair. Those who are IN today may be "Total OUT" tomorrow!

16134.name: Fencing
16134.description: A very unusual card game of Fencing. The exact moves performed in the real sport are included, and work realistically. Predates En Garde by some decades!

16136.description:
From the Game's Instructions:
"Ready for a high-flying hot-air balloon adventure? Pick a pony -- Sunny Daze, Pinkie Pie, Sparkleworks or Rainbow Dash. Then spin the spinner to move your pony pawn from cloud to cloud above Ponyville. Play special cards to move ahead, or to switch places with another pony. First one to 'touch down' at Celebration Castle wins the game!"

It's a slightly different take on classics like Candyland and Chutes-and-Ladders ... incorporating both a spinner and drawn cards.

Note to Admins: This is different than the other "My Little Pony" games listed on BGG so far ...
16136.name: My Little Pony: Dream Castle

16137.name: R.A.G.
16137.description:
"Welcome to the world of publishing: As a publisher of the Weekly Rag, thousands of readers look to you for news and gossip. Your tabloid is seeking to have the best stories in the business. Deal the cards and write some headlines!"

Self-published game consisting of 96 word cards, a few blank cards and a couple of quick-reference cards. Each word card has 4 different words on it along with either a positive sign ( + ) or a negative sign ( - ). Words are articles, nouns, verbs, adjectives or adverbs. Different symbols correspond to the different parts of speech.

Everyone is dealt 10 cards face down (your personal pile) and players then draw 3 of those cards to form a hand. Remaining cards form a draw pile. On your turn, you may start a headline with a noun or article card, add a card to your headline (following normal sentence structure), add a card to someone else's headline (if you have a headline of your own started) or pass (and draw a card from the draw pile). If you use a card from your hand, you draw a card from your personal pile. Headlines must start with a noun or article and must contain at least 2 nouns and 1 verb. The headline is completed and set aside when the second noun is placed.

The round continues until a player runs out of cards from both their personal pile and their hand. Each player then scores their completed headlines. Incomplete headlines do not score any points. Subtract the number of negative cards from the number of positive cards in the headline. If the result is positive, this is your score. If the result is negative, take the absolute value as your score (e.g. you get 4 points for a score of -4).

The first player to reach a score of 10 wins the game. However, "The primary purpose of RAG is to be entertaining. Many of the headlines will be funny. Some of them will be VERY funny! Enjoy the game and laugh a lot. Laughing is good for you!"

16138.description:
This is the 2nd expansion for Dungeons & Dragons by Hasbro.

Objective: the adventurers have to enter the haunted woods to fight evil and find the mad druid Elwick and defeat him...

The new rules include the addition of wandering monsters and the trample ability.

Expands:

Dungeons and Dragons the Fantasy Adventure Board Game
16138.name: Dungeons & Dragons: The Fantasy Adventure Board Game – Forbidden Forest Expansion Pack
boardgameexpansion: Dungeons & Dragons: The Fantasy Adventure Board Game
boardgamefamily: From RPG books to board games

16139.description:
A neat dice race with a simple version for younger players.

Ooooh, it's scary in Count Dracula's castle! Bravely, the little vampire rolls the dice again: A garlic, two bats. And so he makes his way closer to the treasure chamber!
16139.name: Draculix

boardgamehonor: 2005 Deutscher Lernspielpreis "3 years and up" Nominee
2005 Spiel des Jahres Kinderspiel Recommended
16140.name: Zahlenzwerge
16140.description: A learning game about the first numbers. Whoever lands on a treasure space by using luck, imagination and the right numbers receives a prize. Who will have the most prizes at the end of the game?

16141.description: Fredericus, by Eligio Cazzato, is a board game for 2-4 falconers at the court of Kaiser Frederik II in Castel del Monte. The box includes 118 cards (43x66mm), an illustrated game board, and a falcon, hawk, and betting coin for each player. The goal of the game is to catch as many mythological beasts as possible. After each capture, the catches of the other players can be bet on and the Kaiser can award prizes to the players.
16141.name: Fredericus

16142.description:
Michelle Schanen is continuing to play with her successful ghosts - but this time with new figures, new scenery and a completely different game principle. In Geisterwäldchen (Ghost Forest), the old ghost that the children wanted to scare is now after the children themselves. The children have hidden themselves in the mysterious woods near the old ruined castle in which the ghost lived. He circles the woods, while the children try not to get caught. Magnets in the figures play a major role. A tense chase game that's not just for kids!

Ages 5 and up.
16142.name: Geisterwäldchen

16144.description:
Fancying themselves spies like those in the movies, a group of little animal rascals have decided to sneak into Farmer Papa's neighboring orchard to gather gardening intelligence (i.e., fruit) they can use on their own farm. Competing with both open and hidden information, they must identify bluffing and beware of the others' weapons. The player who can obtain the most yummiest fruit will be recognized as the best fruit spy!

In Fruit Spy, six farmhouse boards are arranged in a circle in a random order, with 2-4 fruit tokens (valued 1-7) placed randomly upon them. Two stand-up figures — Farmer Papa and Daly — are placed on their respective starting farmhouses.

Each player has eight spy cards in hand — trick cards valued 1-7 and one tool card — and on a player's turn, they place one card face down on a farmhouse of their choice. If another face-down card is already there, the player turns it face up; if the revealed card is a tool card, then both the new card and the tool card are discarded. When cards are played on the farmhouse where one (or both) of the figures stands, that figure is moved — clockwise for Daly, counterclockwise for Farmer Papa. The game ends when one of the figures reaches its starting farmhouse or when all players have played all of their cards.

Fruit tokens are then awarded in order of the players' total strength on each farmhouse: the strongest player takes the fruit token with the highest Yum-yum value, the second-strongest player takes the next highest-valued token, and so on. Any remaining fruit tokens go to the strongest player. Daly is scored as a fruit token of value 10 while Farmer Papa kicks everyone out of the farmhouse where he stands at the end of the game empty-handed. The player with the highest Yum-yum value total wins!

Earlier versions of Fruit Spy were titled Dead Man's Treasure, with players fighting for treasure chests in exactly the same manner as Fruit Spy.
16144.name: Fruit Spy

16145.name: Mango Tango
16145.description:
A swinging card game.

The mangoes have rhythm! The best mango-tango dancers are chosen to dance in the big competition. Different categories must be filled. The game is about the best dancing schools, dance troupes and formation dancers. Which player will have the most competitors in the finals?

boardgamehonor: 2005 Kinderspielexperten "8-to-13-year-olds" Nominee
16146.name: Mogel-Monster
16146.description:
The amusing monster race!

The monsters of Castle Wobblestone are holding a race. They agree not to use their unnatural powers and capabilities, but none of the monsters actually hold themselves to this agreement. There's so much cheating going on, the entire Castle starts to wobble. But woe to a monster who gets caught! Then he must jump into one of the holes that lead back to the start. Which monster will cheat the best and make it to the goal first?

16147.name: Papa Klapper
16147.description:
The baby rattlesnake race.

Papa Rattler is going out exploring. His six children follow! Daddy speeds ahead, and his babies want to catch up to him. But Papa often moves forward faster than the little ones. Then the name of the game is quickly slither onwards and try to catch up! The baby rattler who reaches papa first is the winner. With fun wooden 3D snakes!

16148.description:
This game is being promoted in some interesting ways. The chocolate company Ferrero has produced 250 000 "Auf heißer Spur" mini-games, sold with Kinder Friends Chocolates. These mini-games are a reduced version with simpler mechanisms of the full game, with cardboard dice to build (see picture). Also, the German TV Channel "Super RTL" uses "Auf heißer Spur" in a weekly game program for kids, called "SpieleGalaxie". The kids must find the guilty thief on the TV screen.

The goal of the game is to follow the clues (shown on 3 dice: starting location, color of dropped diamond, and clothing detail) to find the right thief. Every player tried to find the right thief at the same time, following a circle of cards with suspects. There are also special cards (subway, etc.)
16148.name: Auf heißer Spur

boardgamehonor: 2005 Japan Boardgame Prize Best Childgame Nominee
2005 Kinderspielexperten "5-to-9-year-olds" Nominee
2005 Spiel des Jahres Kinderspiel Recommended
16149.description:
The exciting mole search.

Where are the cheeky moles hiding? In pairs, they dig hither and yon through the grass, peek out of their holes and then disappear again. To pull the right moles out of their holes, the players carefully note the different mole colors. Then they can collect many task cards and collect the most shovels.

Thematically similar to The Mole in the Hole.
16149.name: Up And Down

16150.description:
A light-hearted wooden set collection game for the younger set.

Four colourful fish wait happily in their aquarium tank to be fed. To get lots of food for their own fish, the players carefully shake the food can and arrange the coloured food pieces according to the right cards. A light-hearted set collection game for the very young, who can learn fine motor skills as well as colours. Wooden playing pieces!
16150.name: Fische füttern

boardgamehonor: 2005 Spiel des Jahres Kinderspiel Recommended
16151.name: Krabbel-Trabbel
16151.description:
Your monstrous self has been infected by creepy-crawlies, and you want to rid yourself of them to make yourself calm again, but to make them leave, you need to put in some effort...

In Krabbel-Trabbel, first released as Fleckenmonster, each player starts with up to ten crawler tokens on their monster card, while thirteen action chips are placed face down in a circle. On a turn, the active player reveals one of these action chips, then carries out the order depicted there. Perhaps you need to memorize, then reveal certain actions chips, but often you need to participate in "monster games". You might have a task like making faces, naming ingredients in a soup, or imitating animal sounds, and on your turn you must first imitate in order everything done by the other players, then complete the task in your own way. Complete the task or win the game, and you can remove one of the crawlers on your body. Eliminate all of your crawlers to win!

16152.name: Cockatoo Contest
16152.description:
Parrot fun that demands memory and dexterity.

Four parrots want to land safely on the ever-higher-growing palm trees. The players pay close attention to which parrot sits where. Because whoever remembers the varying colors well collects the tastiest fruits. Exciting gaming fun that requires a good memory and good dexterity.

boardgamehonor: 2003 Kinderspielexperten "5-to-9-year-olds" Nominee
2005 Japan Boardgame Prize Best Childgame Nominee
16153.description:
Part of the Ravensburger Labyrinth Games series.

Simultaneously through the labyrinth - the speed game.

All players speed through the labyrinth with the eyes at the same time. Which paths will lead to the treasure? And which are dead ends? On your treasures - ready, set, go!
16153.name: Labyrinth Treasure Hunt

16154.name: Rutschpartie mit Winnie the Pooh
16154.description:
A fun 3D ladder game.

Winnie and his friends have discovered huge footprints. They bravely follow the trail and a fun and exciting race begins. Especially high gaming enjoyment is guaranteed by the large game board, set up like a roof. Even little children can follow the trail with the help of the colored die and let their playing figure slide over the large game board.

16155.name: Sprich genau, hör genau
16155.description:
Practice language in a game - an organization game.

This game develops your child's language skills. It is perfect to prepare a child, through play, for reading and writing. Included are speech and language games with rhyming words and similar-sounding words. Only he who listens carefully and speaks clearly will find the right word. Three game versions provide age-appropriate play possibilities and individual learning fun.

16156.name: On the Road to Abha
16156.description: On the Road to Abha is a game designed to increase awareness of the sites of historical, cultural, and natural interest in Saudi Arabia. It offers rules for two games, both of which are very simple. The first is a standard "roll-and-move" race from Riyadh to Abha. The second is a collection game, where players attempt to pick up the most coffee pot tokens along the way.

16157.name: Volcano
16157.description:
Ash Sunday's "Volcano" describes itself as "A board game odyssey to the May 18th eruption of Mount St. Helens." A short history of the 1980 eruption is provided.

The game itself is a race from Toutle to Cougar and to the Crater Observation Point, then back again. Pyroclastic flows, mud flows, road blocks, and bureaucracies all serve to deter the players along their route.

Players may choose to remove the "Big Eruption!" card from the deck that eliminates its drawer.

16158.name: Wangaratta
16158.description:
Wangaratta is a game about selling and transporting goods. You are a shipowner and the goal of the game is to ship as much you can, for best price and also to buy one ship in each if the three different weight classes.

To win the game you must have three different ships, have sold merchandise in both London and New York. And of course have the most money.

boardgamehonor: 1994 Vuoden Peli Children's Game of the Year Winner
2006 Årets Spill Best Children's Game Nominee
16160.description:
This game is the children's edition of Alias. The object of the game is to describe and guess pictures to your team mates so that they can guess as many as possible within one minute.

Based on Alias.
boardgameversion: Finnish first edition with vuoden peli award
16160.name: Junior Alias

16161.name: The Wishbone Game
16161.description:
Based on the PBS television series about the little dog with a big imagination.

The object of the game is simple: race around the board to collect your hero's favorite things. Along the way, you'll leap into literature, sniff out adventure, dig for clues, scratch out a game-winning strategy, and search for food (dogs can't live on books alone). The Wishbone Game is a great introduction to the classic works of literature introduced by the world's most classic dog. It's designed for parents and children to play together, and it's more fun than chewing on an old sneaker.

16162.description:
International Game Series game from Multi-Man Publishing.

Target Arnhem is a Japanese wargame that simulates the battle of Arnhem in 1944. It was published in Old Game Journal Magazine #43.

This game is currently being published by Multi-Man Publishing under the title Target Arnhem: Across 6 Bridges, and was distributed free at Origins 2005.
16162.name: Target Arnhem: Across 6 Bridges
